result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathon C Sveom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).
  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Concurrent with: Count 3, revoked.

Court will allow transfer to Jefferson County.
Concurrent with: Count 3.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($243) to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA surcharge is waived.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Attorney Ponath.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jonathon C Sveom in court with attorney Sarah A Ponath.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to counts 2 & 3.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of counts 2 & 3.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read ins.

Court orders the following:
Count 2:
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard conditions).
Concurrent to:  count 3.
STAYED.

Term of Probation: 12 Months.
Concurrent to: count 3.
Court will allow for transfer to Jefferson County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victim listed in the criminal complain.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.




Count 3:
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail 
Concurrent to: count 2
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  12 Months.
Concurrent to:  count 2.
Court will allow for transfer to Jefferson County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as count 2.

Costs: $243
DNA Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jonathon C Sveom in court with attorney Sarah A Ponath.   
First appearance in front of the court.
Defense just received discovery and an offer.

  Hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Signed by Judge Neal Nettesheim on 02/18/15.
